page.title: 16VOGRIE COUNTRY PARK
page.content: THE VOGRIE COUNTY ESTATE LIES 3 MILES NORTH WEST OF PATHHEAD VILLAGE BETWEEN THE VILLAGES OF DEWARTON AND NEWLANDRIG.THE ESTATE IS RUN BY THE MIDLOTHIAN DISTRICT COUNCIL IN CONJUNCTION WITH COUNTRYSIDE COMMISION FOR SCOTLAND.VOGRIE BELONGED TO THE DEWAR FAMILY UNTIL 1905.ITS 260 ACRES IS MADE UP OF MIXED WOODLAND AND AGRICULTURAL LAND.THE TYNE WATER RUNS THROUGH THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE PARK.MANY FACILITIES EXIST IN VOGRIE SUCH AS AN ADVENTURE PLAYGROUND,NATURE TRAILS,BARBEQUE SITE,WOODLAND WALKS,PICNIC AREAS,FLOWER GARDENS ETC. COUNTRYSIDES RANGERS ARE ALWAYS IN ATTENDANCE TO HELP THE PUBLIC IN ANY WAY THEY CAN.MANY SCHOOLS IN THE REGION USE THE PARK FOR ORIENTEERING AND ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES.SITUATED NEAR THE CENTRE OF THE PARK IS VOGRIE
